lead_paragraph: After her university dismissed her for absenteeism after she was treated for ovarian cancer, Liu Lingli began selling clothes on the street to pay her medical bills.

byline.contributor: Owen Guo contributed research from Beijing, and Charlotte Yang contributed research from Hong Kong.

headline.print_headline: Firing of Ailing Professor Prompts Outcry in China
headline.main: Firing of Teacher Battling Cancer Prompts an Outcry in China

snippet: After her university dismissed her for absenteeism after she was treated for ovarian cancer, Liu Lingli began selling clothes on the street to pay her medical bills....
abstract: Many Chinese recoil over fate of Liu Lingli, dismissed from her post as teacher at Lanzhou Jiaotong University because of her excessive absenteeism during treatment for ovarian cancer; Liu, who initiated suit against university, ended up selling clothes on street to pay her medical bills before succumbing to disease; her sudden death has sparked national examination of China's ineffectual labor laws.
